div.p: SHIKARPUR, the chief town of the above district, is situated 18 miles west of the Indus, in a tract of low-lying country annually flooded by the canals from that river. It is a great entrep√¥t for transit trade between the Bolan Pass and Karachi. The population in 1881 numbered 42,496 (males 22,889, females 19,607).
